sections.heading: What is たぶん?
sections.content:
たぶん is an adverb expressing moderate probability or uncertainty, meaning "probably," "maybe," "perhaps," or "likely." It shows the speaker thinks something is likely but isn't certain.

たぶん雨が降る "It'll probably rain" たぶん来ると思う "I think he'll probably come" たぶん大丈夫 "It's probably okay"

children.heading: Expressing moderate certainty
children.content: たぶん行く "I'll probably go" たぶん晴れる "It'll probably be sunny" Shows 50-70% confidence Not completely sure

children.heading: Making tentative predictions
children.content: たぶん彼は知らない "He probably doesn't know" たぶん間違っている "It's probably wrong" Uncertain estimation

children.heading: Softening statements
children.content: Direct: 来る "He'll come" Softer: たぶん来る "He'll probably come" Less assertive

children.heading: Where たぶん fits
children.content: 20-40%: もしかしたら (maybe/possibly) 30-50%: かもしれない (might) 50-70%: たぶん (probably) 70-90%: きっと (surely) 90%+: 絶対に (absolutely) たぶん = moderate probability

children.heading: たぶん + だろう
children.content: たぶん来るだろう "He'll probably come" Double probability marker Common combination

children.heading: たぶん + と思う
children.content: たぶん行くと思う "I think I'll probably go" Layered uncertainty Very tentative

children.heading: たぶん + かもしれない (redundant)
children.content: Redundant: たぶん来るかもしれない ⚠️ Better: たぶん来ると思う ✓ Or: 来るかもしれない ✓ Avoid double uncertainty

children.heading: Beginning of sentence
children.content: たぶん、明日は晴れる "Probably, it'll be sunny tomorrow" Emphasis on uncertainty

children.heading: Before verb/adjective
children.content: 彼はたぶん来る "He'll probably come" たぶん正しい "It's probably correct" Most common position

children.heading: Works in both
children.content: Casual: たぶん大丈夫だと思う "I think it's probably okay" Polite: たぶん大丈夫だと思います "I think it's probably okay" Adjust verb ending

children.heading: Making plans
children.content: たぶん行けると思う "I think I can probably go" たぶん無理かな "It's probably impossible" Uncertain commitments

children.heading: Giving opinions
children.content: たぶんそうだと思う "I think that's probably so" たぶん彼が正しい "He's probably right" Tentative opinions

children.heading: Predictions
children.content: たぶん雨が降る "It'll probably rain" たぶん遅れる "I'll probably be late" Uncertain forecasts

sections.heading: たぶん vs きっと

children.heading: たぶん - Moderate (50-70%)
children.content: たぶん成功する "It'll probably succeed" Less confident Neutral/cautious Can be positive or negative

children.heading: きっと - Strong (75-90%)
children.content: きっと成功する "It'll surely succeed" More confident Optimistic Mainly for positive outcomes

children.heading: Example comparison
children.content: たぶん: たぶん雨が降る "It'll probably rain" きっと: きっと晴れる "It'll surely be sunny" Different confidence levels

sections.heading: たぶん vs おそらく

children.heading: たぶん - Casual/neutral
children.content: たぶん来る "He'll probably come" Everyday conversation Neutral tone

children.heading: おそらく - Formal/written
children.content: おそらく来るでしょう "He'll probably come" More formal Written language Professional contexts

children.heading: Works with both
children.content: Positive: たぶん成功する "Probably will succeed" Negative: たぶん失敗する "Probably will fail" Neutral, works both ways

children.heading: たぶん～と思う
children.content: たぶんそうだと思う "I think that's probably so" たぶん間違ってると思う "I think it's probably wrong" Common, natural combination

children.heading: たぶん～だろう
children.content: たぶん来るだろう "He'll probably come" たぶん大丈夫だろう "It'll probably be okay" Layered probability

children.heading: たぶん～ね/よ
children.content: たぶん大丈夫だよ "It's probably okay" たぶん来るよね "He'll probably come, right?" Casual, conversational

children.heading: Shows lack of confidence
children.content: A: 彼、来る？ "Is he coming?" B: たぶんね "Probably" Not sure, but likely

children.heading: Seeking opinions
children.content: たぶん正しいと思う？ "Do you think it's probably correct?" たぶん間違ってるよね？ "It's probably wrong, right?" Checking uncertain assumptions

children.heading: As a standalone answer
children.content: A: 明日晴れる？ "Will it be sunny tomorrow?" B: たぶん "Probably" Common short response

children.heading: Standard たぶん
children.content: たぶん行く "I'll probably go" Standard Japanese

children.heading: Some dialects use 多分 (same)
children.content: Same meaning Same usage Written with kanji: 多分

children.heading: おそらく (formal)
children.content: おそらく成功するでしょう "It will probably succeed" More formal than たぶん

children.heading: 恐らく (written form)
children.content: 恐らく正しいと思われる "It's probably thought to be correct" Formal written style

children.heading: Overusing uncertainty markers
children.content: Redundant: たぶん来るかもしれないと思う ⚠️ Better: たぶん来ると思う ✓ Or: 来るかもしれない ✓ Don't stack too many

children.heading: Using in very certain situations
children.content: Odd: たぶん太陽は東から昇る ⚠️ Natural: 太陽は東から昇る ✓ Don't use for facts

children.heading: Uncertain responses
children.content: A: 参加する？ "Will you participate?" B: うーん、たぶん... "Hmm, probably..." Shows reluctance/uncertainty

children.heading: Basic
children.content: たぶん雨が降る "It'll probably rain" たぶん来ないと思う "I think he probably won't come" たぶん大丈夫 "It's probably okay"

children.heading: Intermediate
children.content: 天気予報によると、明日はたぶん晴れる "According to the forecast, it'll probably be sunny tomorrow" 時間があれば、たぶん行けると思います "If I have time, I think I can probably go" 彼の話はたぶん本当だと思うけど、 確認したほうがいい "I think his story is probably true, but it's better to confirm"

children.heading: Advanced
children.content: この方法でたぶんうまくいくと思うが、 100%の保証はできない。他の選択肢も 考えておいたほうがいいだろう。 状況によっては、別のアプローチが 必要になるかもしれない。 "I think this method will probably work, but I can't give a 100% guarantee. It would be better to consider other options too. Depending on the situation, a different approach might be necessary." 経済状況を見ると、来年の成長率は たぶん今年より低くなるだろう。 専門家の多くもそう予測している。 ただし、予想外の出来事が起これば、 結果は変わる可能性がある。 "Looking at the economic situation, next year's growth rate will probably be lower than this year. Many experts also predict so. However, if unexpected events occur, the results might change."

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: きっと - Surely (higher certainty) おそらく - Probably (formal) かもしれない - Might (lower certainty) だろう - Probably (conjecture) もしかしたら - Maybe/Perhaps Probability adverbs - Expressing likelihood

examples.sentence: かもしれない - Might (lower certainty)
